review: I tried OTC meds for a couple of years  for my tummy before they found the H. Pylori bacteria was causing my ulcer.  Rabeprazole was added during triple therapy with antibiotics and within a couple of hours my searing pain from abdomen through to my back was gone.  I should only have to take Rabeprazole for 2 months but insurance will not cover it.  I agree it works really well and should be covered by insurance.  I complained to the insurance and told them OTC's are not the same and don't work the same but got nowhere.
Aciphex (rabeprazole):It helped me a lot to recover from H. pylori infection. I took with 2 other medicines as per prescribed to me.
Aciphex (rabeprazole):I was diagnosed with H pylori and was given Aciphex along with two other medicines. Worked very well in treating my ulcer. I continued to take it for years. No side effects.

Aciphex (rabeprazole):I was put on Aciphex after antibiotic/PPI treatment for H.pylori and it does really work.  It has been 1 year and I can feel the difference.  The doctor put me on 12 straight weeks of it at first and now am taking it 2 days on, 1 day off, 2 days on, 1 day off, etc. and it is keeping the reflux and pain away.
